title: Technical Reference Documentation for Article Interface
description: This document outlines the structure of the Article interface, including its properties and intended use in applications.
author: Documentation Team

blocks.content: The Article interface defines the essential attributes of a published article. Each property is intended to provide relevant information about the article, facilitating easy manipulation and retrieval of article data in applications.

id: string - A unique identifier for the article.

title: string - The title of the article.

content: string - The main body of the article, containing the full text.

author: string - The name of the person who wrote the article.

publishDate: Date - The date when the article was published.

description: string - A brief summary or description of the article's content.
There are no predefined constants or default values associated with the Article interface. Each property must be explicitly defined when creating an instance of the interface.

The Article interface itself does not define any exception classes. However, when implementing functionality that utilizes this interface, developers should consider handling errors related to data validation and integrity.

Missing Properties: If any of the required properties (id, title, content, author, publishDate, description) are missing when creating an instance of Article, it may lead to runtime errors.

Invalid Data Types: Providing incorrect data types for any of the properties (e.g., a number instead of a string for id) will result in TypeScript compilation errors.
Ensure that all properties are provided and of the correct type when creating an instance of the Article interface.
